==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=笔}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|竹|聿|t1=bamboo|t2=writing brush|c1=s|c2=p|ls=psc}} – a hand holding a brush {{lang|zh|聿}}. The bamboo ({{lang|zh|竹}}) refers to the material of traditional Chinese brushes.

===Etymology===
{{zh-ref|Benedict (1972)}} surmises that this might be a loan from Austro-Tai into Sino-Tibetan; ''cf.'' {{cog|map-pro|*bulut||hairy filaments of certain plants, husk}} ({{cog|ceb|bulut}}).

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ふで}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''funde'' below.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Now the most common pronunciation in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ふで|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふで}}

# a writing [[brush]], a painting brush, a [[pen]]
# [[writing]]:
## the [[act]] of [[writing]]
## something [[written]]
## [[handwriting]], how someone [[write]]s

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|en|pen}} sense is more commonly expressed using the {{etyl|en|-}}-derived term {{ja-r|ペン}}.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ふんで}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''fumite'' below. Listed with this reading in the {{lang|ja|観智院}} (''Kanchi-in'') edition of the 11th- or 12th-century {{lang|ja|類聚名義抄}} (''[[w:Ruiju myōgishō|Ruiju Myōgishō]]'') dictionary.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

[[supersede|Superseded]] by the ''fude'' reading above in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ふんで}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふんで}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ふんで|obsolete}} same as for ''fude'' above: [[brush]]; [[pen]]; [[writing]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ふみて}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ふみて|文|tr1=fumi|t1=writing|手|tr2=te|t2=hand}}. Appears with this reading in the ''[[w:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]]'', circa 759.

[[supersede|Superseded]] by the ''fude'' reading above in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ふみて}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふみて}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ふみて|obsolete}} same as for ''fude'' above: [[brush]]; [[pen]]; [[writing]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ひつ}}
{{IPAchar|/pitu/}} → {{IPAchar|/fitu/}} → {{IPAchar|/hitu/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ひつ}} {{m|zh|筆|tr= pit ||writing brush}}. Compare modern {{etyl|hak|-}} and {{etyl|nan|-}} ''pit'', {{etyl|cmn|-}} ''bǐ''.

{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|ひつ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}
